thread.title: US reworks charges against Darren Sharper co-defendants
thread.title_full: US reworks charges against Darren Sharper co-defendants

title: US reworks charges against Darren Sharper co-defendants
text:
New federal indictment reworks charges against Darren Sharper co-defendants 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Published: 10/22/15 6:51   6:52 pm EDT 
NEW ORLEANS â€” Federal prosecutors have made adjustments to their case against two co-defendants of Darren Sharper, the former NFL star who has pleaded guilty or no-contest to drug and sexual assault cases in four states. 
A new grand jury indictment Thursday eliminates a charge that former St. Bernard Parish Sheriff's Deputy Brandon Licciardi (lih-CHAR'-dee) withheld information from a grand jury. 
Licciardi still faces six criminal charges alleging witness tampering and that he, like Sharper, distributed drugs with the intent to commit rape. 
Co-defendant Erik Nunez, already facing a federal charge that he damaged a cell phone used as evidence in the case, now faces a charge that he, too, distributed drugs intending to commit rape. The men face related charges in Louisiana state court. Both have pleaded not guilty.
